        ?
      • `?`(x): untyped

Author:Don-Duong Quach
License:MIT
Version:0.1.0

Source

Implements operators !, checks for falsiness, and ?, truthiness, on various types, including dot expression chains.

Example:

import src/nilean
type
  A = object
    b: ptr B
    s: seq[ptr C]
    p: proc():int
    r: R
    cs: cstring
    pp: pointer
  B = object
    foo: float
  C = object
    bar: bool
    r: R
  R = ref object
    val: int

var a = cast[ptr A](alloc(sizeof(A)))
var b = cast[ptr B](alloc(sizeof(B)))
b.foo = 100f

doAssert ?a
doAssert !a.b
a.b = b
doAssert ?a.b

doAssert !a.s

var c = cast[ptr C](alloc(sizeof(C)))
c.bar = true
a.s = @[c]
doAssert ?a.s
doAssert ?a.s[0]
doAssert ?a.s[0]

var p:proc():int
doAssert !p
p = proc():int = 1
doAssert ?p

doAssert !a.p
a.p = p
doAssert ?a.p

var r:R
doAssert !r
doAssert !a.r

doAssert !a.s[0].r
c.r = R()

doAssert ?a.s[0].r

doAssert !a.cs
a.cs = cstring"Hello"
doAssert ?a.cs

doAssert !a.pp
a.pp = cast[pointer](a.s[0].addr)
doAssert ?a.pp

Macros

macro `!`(x: ptr | ref | pointer | cstring | proc): untyped

Templates

template `!`(x: SomeFloat): untyped
template `!`(x: SomeOrdinal | char): untyped
template `!`(x: string): untyped
template `!`[T](x: seq[T]): untyped
template `?`(x): untyped
